alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, southeastern Lexington, northwestern Orangeburg and southeastern Richland Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gaston, or 15 miles south of Cayce, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, McEntire Air Base, Gaston, Congaree National Park, Hopkins, Sandy Run, Gadsden, Horrel Hill, Swansea, North, Woodford, New Zion, Lexington Acres Pond, Fort Jackson McCrady Training Center and Silver Lake. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 118 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central South Carolina. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
